image.altText: A man wears a suit and has short hair. He is superimposed on top of five colour supercars driving on a track.

props.synopsis: Supercars will be racing around Adelaide next weekend, but a different political race is underway in the southern suburbs. But how much of an impact has the state's former opposition leader had on this by-election?

title.children: What impact will outgoing Liberal leader David Speirs have on the by-election race?

image.altText: Lewis Parkin murder victim

props.synopsis: Police say a 23-year-old man was found at the scene with life-threatening injuries and died in hospital a short time later.

title.children: Man charged with murder after 23yo allegedly stabbed in Adelaide's CBD

image.altText: Yellow police crime scene tape with a blurred suburban street in the background.

props.synopsis: Police say they believe an Adelaide man was murdered before his house was set on fire to deliberately destroy the evidence.

title.children: SA Police believe man found dead in house fire was murdered

image.altText: A couple in hats standing in the foreground, with red-dirt behind them and a bakery to the right.

props.synopsis: In a rising cost-of-living crisis, housing affordability and lifestyle factors are increasingly popular reasons why some people move beyond Australia's big cities.

title.children: Why these couples packed up their lives to live in some of Australia's most remote areas

image.altText: An echidna with light coloured spines walking on grass

props.synopsis: For 35 years American researcher Peggy Rismiller has been studying Kangaroo Island's animals, from snakes to echidnas.

title.children: Researcher who spies on echidnas' sex lives says there's a lot to learn about the enigmatic animals

image.altText: Roz Hervey sitting on set at a Restless Dance Theatre rehearsal

props.synopsis: Roz Hervey has accessed voluntary assisted dying two years on from her Motor Neurone Disease diagnosis.

title.children: 'Goodbye beautiful humans': arts veteran farewells loved ones with heartfelt letter

image.altText: Uncle Moogy Sumner AM

props.synopsis: A Ngarrindjeri man's remains which were once traded for a prehistoric tiger skull will finally make their way home this weekend, as one of fourteen First Nations ancestors returned to Australia from United States museums.

title.children: 'Another one of our old people coming back home': Human remains traded for prehistoric animal parts returned to Australia

image.altText: A man with white beard wearing a hat and sunglasses

props.synopsis: A man who groomed and sexually abused a nine-year-old Filipino girl after befriending her mother has been sentenced to 15 years' imprisonment.

title.children: Paedophile handed 15-year sentence for persistent sexual abuse of child overseas

image.altText: A pub and a general store overlooking a river with a pine tree in the middle

props.synopsis: Anger at the closure of popular tourist attractions in the border town of Nelson over the past three years sparks a movement hoping to cut through bureaucracy and create a new plan for the future.

title.children: After years of hard knocks, residents rage against red tape 'quagmire' in bid to save tiny town

image.altText: Close of up young woman with brown curly hair, gazes seriously, wears black leather jacket, white blouse, necklace.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide singer and songwriter won no less than four awards including best new artist, best solo artist, and the most popular pop artist.

title.children: Solo artist Aleksiah wins big at the SA Music Awards as Guy Sebastian is inducted into hall of fame

image.altText: A man in a suit and glasses carrying a bag walks along a sidewalk next to a sandstone-colored building

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle first became an internal whistleblower in 2017, when he became concerned about operations in the tax office.

title.children: Tax office whistleblower Richard Boyle set to stand trial

image.altText: Three Navy ships in the sea

props.synopsis: Tensions on the peninsula have been at their highest pitch in years, with the North launching a flurry of ballistic missiles in violation of UN sanctions.

title.children: North Korea jams GPS signal, affecting ships and aircraft in the south

image.altText: Sir Ian Botham holds a fish

props.synopsis: They were sworn enemies on the cricket pitch but now English legend Ian Botham has thanked his old Ashes rival Merv Hughes for saving him from crocodiles.

title.children: Ashes rivalry forgotten as Merv Hughes helps Ian Botham escape from croc-infested river near Darwin

image.altText: Rows of Iranian servicemen stand on guard under a large Iranian flag.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice says it has charged 51-year-old Farhad Shakeri, alleging Iranian authorities had tasked him with preparing hits on Israeli and American citizens, including the president-elect.

title.children: Man charged over alleged Iranian plot to assassinate Donald Trump

image.altText: Four men hold beers while smiling at the camera for a selfie while sitting in a stadium

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to Israelis who say they were attacked by people who asked if they were Jewish in Amsterdam after a match between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Ajax.

title.children: 'Anti-Semitic hit-and-run squad' attacks leave Israeli soccer fans scrambling to leave Amsterdam, vowing to never return

image.altText: John Bingham, dressed in a suit sits on a bed behind his future wife in a dress and sweater.

props.synopsis: Wealthy aristocrat Lord Lucan was accused of killing his nanny and attacking his wife inside his London home. But after half a century of speculation about his whereabouts, his female victims have been forgotten.

title.children: Forgotten amid the enduring mystery of Lord Lucan are the women he bludgeoned in a London mansion

image.altText: Man stands on stage wearing a suit

props.synopsis: It is unclear who is behind the reported texts, how many people had received them, or how the recipients were targeted.

title.children: FBI investigating racist mass texts sent to Black Americans

image.altText: A man in a police uniform stands outside a house surrounded by police cars with flashing lights and other officers.

props.synopsis: A police officer found incriminating evidence on a phone. But he was the one charged. So what happened?

title.children: A cop was accused of sharing a suspect's explicit videos. But there was more to the story

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures a distance between his two hands

props.synopsis: Australia's election campaign will not be fought in the way the US race was fought: as a battle between rage or joy. But we should despair that it will feature little of the policy rigour or ambition that economists like Geoff Carmody brought to battles gone by.

title.children: Americans may feel their government services have let them down. But Trump has no solid policy solutions to the problems

image.altText: A Hillcrest Primary School sign with hundreds of bunches of flowers arranged on the ground nearby, a

props.synopsis: Nearly three years after the Hillcrest tragedy in Tasmania, the first week of a criminal hearing against the jumping castle operator has wrapped up. This is what we learned.

title.children: After three years, Hillcrest families endure four days of details about the few minutes that tore them apart

image.altText: A woman smiles with blond labrador dog jumping up. She leans on mountain of plastic

props.synopsis: Before food even gets to the grocer, tonnes of plastic have been used to produce it on the farm. Now, Victorian farmers have built a recycling plant to tackle the issue — and it all started in the local pub.

title.children: How a chat at the pub led to a small town solving one of the biggest plastic waste problems in Australia

image.altText: A man with a silver beard wearing a red cap that reads: 'Jesus is my savior, Trump is my president'

props.synopsis: As we crunch data and pore over the exit polls to try to get an understanding of the way America voted, along with the economy and immigration, religion must also be understood as a decisive factor delivering victory to the Republicans.

title.children: The power of God, the power of the presidency: How religion helped Trump win

image.altText: A tree whose trunk has been twisted.

props.synopsis: You may have heard of scar trees, but how about trees-in-trees? These different types of "modified trees" tell a story about Indigenous culture, if you know how to read them.

title.children: Hundreds of modified trees on outback property described as a 'national treasure'

image.altText: A woman next to a gas cooker

props.synopsis: When Brisbane City Council cut electricity and barbecues to two homeless camps, Kira Leaf came with generators and gas cookers.

title.children: When council cut electricity and barbecues for the homeless Kira came with gas cookers

image.altText: A sign out the front of Bacchus Marsh Grammar.

props.synopsis: The Victorian mother of teenage girl whose fake nude images were circulated online says boys should be educated so they don't behave in a manner where girls feel unsafe.

title.children: Mum of schoolgirl caught up in AI fake porn scandal rejects social media ban

image.altText: a couple posing with friends in the VIP section of a concert

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has frozen the assets and appointed receivers to a Gold Coast couple and their companies after an ASIC investigation revealed that nearly $40 million of investors' money was likely gambled at casinos.

title.children: NDIS property developer under investigation for allegedly gambling $39m of investor funds

image.altText: Reece Kershaw speaks about review into Brittany Higgins's texts

props.synopsis: Australia has missed out in a bid to join Interpol's executive committee, with representatives from China and Qatar elected instead

title.children: China and Qatar beat Australia for position on international policing body

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne walks off the ground as Pakistan celebrates

props.synopsis: Australia fell to its heaviest home loss in a one day match since 1992 courtesy of a nightmare batting display, but coach Andrew McDonald isn't prepared for his charges to taper their aggression at all.

title.children: Australian coach says team 'believes in the style we want to play' despite embarrassing batting flop against Pakistan

image.altText: A cockatoo with missing feathers and a crumbling beak on a balcony in front of the ocean

props.synopsis: Avian experts warn people not to feed birds amid a highly contagious and incurable virus that causes feather loss and beak deformities, ultimately resulting in a "long, slow death".

title.children: Backyard bird feeders spreading incurable disease in cockatoos and parrots

image.altText: NSW Police establish a crime scene in Wilton south-west of Sydney

props.synopsis: Following a public appeal for information, a 32-year-old man walked into Narellan Police Station where he was arrested.

title.children: Man arrested after teenage boy found dead in bushland in south-west Sydney

image.altText: Australian dollar notes and Chinese Yuan.

props.synopsis: Stella says she had no idea she was involved in an international money laundering operation until a text message from China warned her bank account there had been frozen.

title.children: International students tricked into becoming money laundering 'mules' for scammers

image.altText: A woman holds up a sign showing a tombstone with the words "Roe 1973-2022".

props.synopsis: Abortion and reproductive rights have been a divisive issue in the United States since Roe v Wade was overturned by the Supreme Court in 2022 and figured heavily in the election campaign.

title.children: Ten US states have voted on whether to protect abortion rights. Here's what they said

image.altText: Firefighter standing in dark in front of burning building

props.synopsis: The blaze erupted on Wednesday morning and spread rapidly, fanned by fierce seasonal Santa Ana winds from California's desert interior.

title.children: More than 130 homes destroyed by California wildfire

image.altText: Como resident Paul Bozonie inside his house impacted by the burst water pipe.

props.synopsis: Paul Bozonie was one of the residents whose home was flooded with thousands of litres of water due to a burst pipe on Friday.

title.children: 'I could cry': Locals in Sydney's Como brace for mould as homes, belongings drenched by burst water pipe
